newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Spring/White Wheat- Spring bids remain lower.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Spring/White Wheat- Spring bids remain lower.

text.p: Dark northern spring and soft white wheat values fell on Wednesday as dealers reported very little movement.
Farmers are holding tight to their new crop, waiting for higher prices, one Minnesota dealer said.
He said about 60 to 70 percent of the spring wheat harvest is over, but rain has delayed some harvesting in northern North Dakota.
In Montana, the spring wheat harvest is also winding down in the southern part of the state. "In northern and central Montana, it (the harvest) is going strong," a Montana dealer said.
Even the soft wheat harvest in the Pacific Northwest is almost over, an Oregon dealer said. "The harvest is on is downward tail," he said.
MGE spring wheat closed lower in thin trade with September down 3-1/2 cents at $4.61-1/2 a bushel.
Price per bushel for 14-pct protein dark northern spring, durum and white wheats, in dollars per bushel:
Spring Chg Durum(m) Chg White Chg
Spring Chg HRW 12pct Chg White Chg
